sentences.english: Some 28 percent of adolescents say they are too tired to exercise, due to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 28%的年轻人表示，由于睡眠不足而没劲儿运动。

sentences.english: The new premier is forming his government mainly from young men.
sentences.chinese: 这位新总理主要从年轻人中物色人选组建政府。

sentences.english: I asked the strange boy, raising my eyebrows in curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 我好奇地扬起眉毛问这个奇怪的年轻人。

sentences.english: Nothing was heard in the room but the hurrying pen of the stripling.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里悄然无声，只有年轻人的笔匆忙划过纸页。

sentences.english: The bright young man can get ahead quickly in the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 这位聪明的年轻人在旅游业界很快获得成功。

sentences.english: However, many young people do not seem to realize the importance of modesty.
sentences.chinese: 然而，许多年轻人似乎没有实现谦逊的重要性。

sentences.english: Lots of young people have their hair dyed.
The young people in Avonlea now are not what they were in our day.
sentences.chinese: 阿冯丽现在的年轻人和那时的我们不一样。

sentences.english: I was a nervous child, and when I grew, I was a nervous young man.
sentences.chinese: 我从小胆小怯弱，长大了，仍是一个胆怯的年轻人。

sentences.english: Teaching child is making youngs headache.
sentences.chinese: 教育小孩对年轻人来说很头痛。

sentences.english: The young man shot himself down from the hill.
sentences.chinese: 那个年轻人从山上冲下来。

sentences.english: The two young guys' caressingspooning there are plain an eye-sore.
sentences.chinese: 看那两个年轻人在那里又搂又吻的真让人看不下去。

sentences.english: Among them, there is often a young man listening to the old monk sitting under a tree view.
sentences.chinese: 其中，有一位年轻人也常坐在树下听老和尚说法。

sentences.english: Feng cares less about himself than the young people of his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 比起同乡的年轻人，峰更少关心他自己。

sentences.english: Their advocacy about celebrity sometimes let youngsters become fans of so-called idols.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宣传有时会让年轻人陷入偶像崇拜之中。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to make more youthful/to promote younger staff
ordinary person/private citizen/people/the person in the street
